results.title: Transmission, drive shaft and differential
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids and Century Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”
An explanation of the transmission, drive shaft and differential, indicating maintenance methods to be adopted.

results.title: Transmission of rotary motion
results.creator_credit: British Council, Science Films and Frank A. Goodlife
results.brief_description: Gives a simple explanation of the transmission of rotary motion. Shows and disc usses examples of simple shafts, flexible shafting, gear drive, chain drive, and belt drive.

results.title: Transmission of electricity
results.brief_description: How electricity is transmitted from the power station to the consumer. The principles of the transformer are developed from simple experiments; shows a modern transformer station and explains the principle of step-up and step-down transformers; shows the operation of a circuit breaker; shows the grid system and the network of sub-stations which supply power for factories and homes.

results.title: Transition generation: a third world problem
results.creator_credit: Alex Von Wetter and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Shows the problems of the first generation of literate young people in Afghanistan, which began a modernisation program in the ‘50’s. Discusses the immensity of the social, emotional and cultural flexibility required of these young people.

results.title: Transfigure [exhibition opening title sequence]
results.brief_description:
Contains motion graphics treatment of the word ‘Transfigure’ in aqua blue on black background. Produced by ACMI Design for the opening/promotional moving image titles for the exhibition of the same name.

‘Transfigure’ was an ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition, held 8 December 2003 - 9 May 2004.
See Exhibition activity record “Transfigure” (ID 9) for more information
The exhibition Transfigure will explore transformations of perception, body, movement, space and landscape to reveal tensions and wonder between technology and nature, identity and image. Moving through ACMI’s renowned Screen Gallery, visitors will encounter digital bodies, artificial intelligence, virtual constructions, gameplay scenarios, and startling images that will surprise and transform their experience. Transfigure will feature three internationally acclaimed interactive installations: Osmose and Ephémère*, immersive virtual reality environments by Canadian artist Char Davies; and Prosthetic Head, a computer-generated head that converses with visitors, created by Australian artist Stelarc. Also featuring, from ACMI’s Collections, other compelling media artworks by prominent Australian and international artists: Ian Andrews; Drew Berry; Paul Brown; Justine Cooper; Chris Cunningham (with Björk); Gina Czarnecki; Robert Gligorov; selectparks; Soda; Mike Stubbs; Steina Vasulka; Tamás Walizcky; Vikki Wilson. Curated by Alessio Cavallaro.

results.title: Transfiguration
results.brief_description: Summary; A woman lying in bed thinking of her own existence and fulfilment of her life, experiences fusion of these elements in a transfiguration of thought. The images are cut in varying lengths based on part of the First Movement of Bruckner’s 9th Symphony.

results.title: Transfer of power
results.creator_credit: Sir Arthur Hallam Elton, Shell Film Unit and Geoffrey Bell
results.brief_description: A history of the toothed wheel. This film provides a clear exposition of the historical development of the means of transferring power from the simple lever to the wheel and pulley, and finally the gear. This film has become famous throughout the world for the imaginative parallel it draws between the development of mechanisation and the general progress of industrial civilisation.

results.title: Transcribing. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Secretary”
Following through a typical series of transcribing assignments, we learn about the placing of work materials to avoid waste motion; establishing priorities so that rush items get out first; and typing techniques for faster, neater letters. Basic letter forms and procedures for transcribing from a dictating machine.
